answers.answer: Lots of things can cause tremors and shaking, including stress and diabetes and many more. My tremors are from hypothyroid and I had a friend who's hands shook for several years, turned out she had an exhaust leak in her car and she was slowly being poisoned. I suggest seeing a doc, it could be something simple but at least you'd know. Since you're in college you might be able to get free med help through school clinic, etc. if $ is an issue. Also are you eating/drinking something new? Our eating habbits can affect us greatly, we can also develope allergies and sensitivities to certain foods.Let us know how you are.
Thanks.  Well, I went home for labor day and guess what?  My hands stopped shaking.  They started trembling again when got back to school, but now they're fine.  I guess it was all psychological.

Could be, but could also be physical. So I'd go to a doc if the shakes start again. I hate when we can't explain why something is happening to us! I'm glad you're feeling better :), and thanks for letting me know!

question: For about a week now my hands have been trembling nonstop and it's been getting worse, could this be diabetes?  Both my aunts have it.  I'm a college freshman, could it be just nerves?  Would that last a week?
title: trembling hands
